Moo::CubeRenderTarget

Moo::CubeRenderTarget Class Reference

This class implements functionality to handle a cubic environment render target. More...

Detailed Description

This class implements functionality to handle a cubic environment render target.

bool Moo::CubeRenderTarget::create ( uint32  cubeDimensions,
const Colour &  clearColour = (DWORD)0x00000000 
)

This method creates a cubemap and a z/stencil buffer, of the supplied dimensions.

Parameters:
cubeDimensions the size of each side of the cubemap.
Returns:
true if the method succeeds.

bool Moo::CubeRenderTarget::pushRenderSurface ( D3DCUBEMAP_FACES  face  ) 

This method sets a render surface, it does NOT store the previous render target etc, so it is important to call RenderContext::pushRendertarget if you want to restore the previous render target.

Parameters:
face the identifier of the cubemap face to set as a render target.
Returns:
true if the operation was successful

HRESULT Moo::CubeRenderTarget::release (  )  [virtual]

This method releases the cubemap and the zbuffer surface.

Reimplemented from Moo::BaseTexture.

const std::string & Moo::CubeRenderTarget::resourceID (  )  const [virtual]

This method implements a stub accessor for the resource id of the texture.

Returns:
an empty string.

Reimplemented from Moo::BaseTexture.

void Moo::CubeRenderTarget::setCubeViewMatrix ( D3DCUBEMAP_FACES  face,
const Vector3 &  centre 
)

This method sets up the view matrix for rendering to a specified cubemap face.

Parameters:
face the cubemap face we want to render to.
centre the camera position we want to render from.
